articles.title: Argentine grain truckers strike to urge higher rates amid harvest
articles.description: "There are no negotiations currently underway," said Edgardo Aniceto, spokesperson of the Federation of Argentine Transporters (FETRA), adding that the strike had no definite timeline. About 85% of Argentina's grain volume is transported by truck from the fields to the country's ports, and truck traffic is particularly heavy during the second quarter of the year.
articles.content:
Truckers in Argentina started an indefinite strike on Monday to demand higher rates for transporting grain and livestock, which could hit grain exports during a key part of the harvest.

articles.title: Argentine grain truckers strike to urge higher rates amid harvest
articles.description: About 85% of Argentina's grain volume is transported by truck from the fields to the country's ports.
articles.content:
By Maximilian Heath
BUENOS AIRES, April 11 (Reuters) - Truckers in Argentina started an indefinite strike on Monday to demand higher rates for transporting grain and livestock, which could hit grain exports during a key part of the harvest.

articles.title: Hat tricks for Mbappe and Neymar as PSG routs Clermont 6-1
articles.description: Lionel Messi picked out Neymar, who rifled into the far corner in the sixth minute for the opener. The Argentina star then chested down a cross from Neymar in the 19th to provide a volleyed pass for Mbappe, who beat goalkeeper Arthur Desmas on Saturday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Motorcycling-Marquez doesn't remember much of Indonesia crash
articles.description: "If I don't feel it then I don't push because then an unexpected crash will arrive like Indonesia. "Even for Argentina, I was very close to coming but I didn't feel motivated and I didn't want to take that risk.
articles.content: Six-times MotoGP champion Marc Marquez does not remember much about his crash in Indonesia and will be cautious on his return to action at this weekend's Grand Prix of the Americas in Austin, Texas. Honda rider Marquez, 29, did not race in Indonesia ... [1193 chars]

articles.title: Paulo Londra’s ‘Plan A’ Rules Billboard Argentina Hot 100 for 2nd Week
articles.description: Paulo Londra's 'Plan A' rules the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 for a second week. J Balvin & Ed Sheeran’s “Sigue” debuts at No. 57.
articles.content: Paulo Londra’s “Plan A” spends a second week at No. 1 on the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart (dated April 9). The track, released via Warner Music Latina, marked the Argentinian’s official return to the music scene, and debuted at No. 1 on the Marc... [1675 chars]

articles.description: Maradona's eldest daughter claims that the Argentina shirt being auctioned is not the one her late father wore when he scored the infamous 'Hand of God' goal against England.
articles.content:
Dalma Maradona said the shirt was actually worn by her father during the goalless first half of the 1986 World Cup quarter-final.
